intro: Deutzia cymuligera, commonly known as the clustered deutzia, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia, particularly China. It features slender, arching branches that bear clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers in early spring. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are dark green and turn yellow in the fall. It typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters and thrives in partial to full sun. Deutzia cymuligera is valued for its ornamental value in gardens and its ability to tolerate a variety of soil conditions.
